intro: Arachne cordifolia, commonly known as the heart-leaved arachne, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
